ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 1 - - It would have been nice to have a few more supplemental readings, especially in the beginning, to put the casebook into more familiar territory.Question 2 - - While I appreciated Marjorie's style of addressing things as they came up, especially in the beginning I could've used some more straightforward explanations, a glossary, etc.Question 7 - - Marjorie was wonderful, a breath of fresh air!Question 8 - - great class.
Question9: I think there should be a mandatory filed trip to a planning board or ZBA meeting. If it was officially on the syllabus, it would be easier for us to plan accordingly.
Shanksy was very entertaining and we had great discussion, she could have lead though the material more firmly and faster.
Learning about land use law from a seasoned, enthusiastic practitioner in a low-key environment.
Vigorous in class discussion
Having this class taught by a practitioner was invaluable; someone who knew the law but also knew how things work in the real world, and was working on cases dealing with these issues.
Marjorie's attitude and instruction and the atmosphere of the classThe go the speed we need structureFun assignment/paper to finish upLearned a ton
The professor. She works in the field and gave us a lot of practical advice
Attorney Shansky is dynamic, fun and very knowledgeable.

I found Professor Shansky delightful to learn from -- she is very kind and considerate, and is also very clear in her approach and in her explanations.This course provides a great introductory overview of legal land use issues and is beneficial to anyone who will be dealing with zoning issues in their future work.
The instructor was very smart, extremely nice and supportive, and a very eloquent and good instructor.
The opportunity to learn from an incredibly knowledgable and experienced practitioner in the field. The bridging of practice and academia was one of the most beneficial aspects of this course.
In-class debates, multiple perspectives, instructor humor

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I think it would have been great to establish a field trip to a local planning meeting right off the bat. Instead, we waited until the end of the semester and then only half the class was able to make it to the meeting. A mandatory field trip (with several date options) would have improved everyone's understanding of how a zoning board/commission meeting really works.

Would really be helpful to have the first class be a primer on law - not even land use law, but just law in general. Most of us had never seen a case book before, weren't sure how to read it, interpret it, etc. It was a skill eventually learned, but if it's explained earlier it would help us get more out of the course. Much of the legal jargon is unavoidable and fun to learn, but at the same time, could be distracting for our purposes.
A bit more organization at the start would help
The professor should start with explaining the main concepts. We went over them as we came to them over the course, and some were not made clear
Please leave a copy of the text on reserve in the library.

increase the pace, maybe have little responce papers?the exam had very little to do with what we were learning--also its BS to allow people to use the internet for an exam. Posing scenarios with questions like many law classes would have been a better format since that is how the rest of the class worked.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: She was always very responsive.
The instructor was very responsive
Excellent- Attorney Shansky was very responsive via email and always available before or after class for a quick chat.
Professor Shansky responded to emails quickly, an encouraged students to contact her or stay after class to ask any additional questions they had. She was very generous with her time.
The instructor was very available and was terrific in private consolations! She is just great!

The instructor was always available for help and constantly reminded us of her availability. While I did not seek her assistance as much as I perhaps should have, when I did it was always extremely helpful and sincere.
not a whole lot of help needed or requested

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Burgeoning interest in land use.

I see this as a foundational course on introducing the topics of land use planning in the context of environmental management. I hope to use the knowledge from this course as a base upon which to build further study and self-exploration in to the topic of land use planning next academic year.
I'm studying land use and the legal perspective was very interesting

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It seemed appropriate and interesting, and the professor is quite engaging and knowledgeable.
Out of interest from the land use seminar in the fall.
I am interested in real estate development
I wanted to learn how local land use law addresses forestry issues.

I had never taken a course on land use planning and the integration of the legal perspective and the practicality of it also appealed to me. I also decided to take the course after noting the excellent course evaluation reviews it received.
entertaining instructor, interesting material

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes, it was better than I expected. I learned a lot and really enjoyed the class.
Did learn a lot; again, the legal jargon was a bit distracting and could have been downplayed or translated more to get more "big picture" out of it for our purposes.
Yes - - even more so.
Yes, although I wanted main concepts to be made clear upfront
Absolutely- I was able to design a final project that was interesting and helpful to me professionally.
Yes, I was hoping to learn the nuts and bolts of land use law, and this class provided me with the concepts and tools that I was seeking.
Yes! I learned a huge amount!
Yes, my expectations were full met and even exceeded.
mostly, was a little slow and shallow, but lots of fun

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: For the most part.
Yes, I learned about planning concepts and a good deal of how law works
yes.
Absolutely
Yes.
mostly, I expected to get more on the principles of law, whereas we talked mostly about the details of cases

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Just jump in and enjoy. Bring your own interests to the readings and discussions, and don't stress out too much.
Keep up with the reading; read all the notes before and after, and not just the cases. Come prepared with questions and have internet ready to look up jargon.
First of all, definitely take it. Second, do a presentation instead of a paper. Third, do all the reading and take really, really good notes.
Read the cases! And think of a project idea early on inorder to get good feedback from the professor
Do a presentation on a topic you really are interested in.

Read the cases critically and come prepared to summarize and really engage with the materials. Ask any questions that are on your mind, no matter how small, and speak with the instructor early about your interests and how they fit in with the course.
Students have to try to keep the class on track and keep pressing through the material, but do also allow for fun discussions
